word:
I will try to write you amid the jostling of the cars. We are on our way to visit your Aunt Sarah, who is very low with consumption. Poor 


                                      -176- 

sufferer! We have hastened to her as soon as we could after the close of the Olcott meeting. . . . We are called to . . . comfort her in the conflict she must have in giving up her children, five in number, the eldest one year and a half younger than Willie. . . .
